result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry Lee Grandy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Per Court order on 10/24/17: $225.60 of the fine/costs owing is converted to 25 hours community service. Victim witness surcharges of $92.00 remains owing, plus the $250 DNA surcharge remains owing, totalling $342.00 to be paid to the Clerk of Court's office within 60 days. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.*
$290.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.

*Per Court order on 10/24/17: Victim witness surcharges of $92.00 remains owing, plus the $250 DNA surcharge remains owing, totalling $342.00 to be paid to the Clerk of Court's office within 60 days. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.*
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
Must be in compliance with treatment regimens.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Barry Lee Grandy in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Door appears from Probation.  8:34 a.m.  AO-Clerk. Ct - $250.00 DNA sample and $65.00 and $27.00 victim witness surcharges not convertable to community service, remaining balance of $225.60 can be paid via 25 hours community service.  Ct -  $342.00 to be paid to COCC,  60 dtp or set up PP.  9:00 a.m. adj.
